title: How to Make a No Bake Mint Chocolate Chip Ice Cream Pie

steps.headline: Set out your ingredients.
steps.description: Include any tools you think might help you.

steps.headline: Cut five to ten Oreos into fourths.
steps.description: You can even cut them into different amounts so it looks a little more normal and un-processed. Make sure if you want to go crazy with the Oreos that you leave at least one left over and not cut!

steps.headline: Mix the Oreo bits into the ice cream.
steps.description: Before you mix, you might want to set the ice cream out for fifteen minutes or so. Then, you won't break your wrist while mixing!

steps.headline: Scoop out the mint chocolate chip ice cream and place it in the pie crust.
steps.description: Don't fill the crust to the top, but go near it. You may want to flatten and spread the ice cream as you set it in the crust to keep track of how much ice cream you'll need.

steps.headline: Flatten the ice cream.
steps.description: You can use a sifting-type ting with a butter knife or flatten it down with a spatula or even a cleaver. The more even the pie, though, the prettier it will look.

steps.headline: Drizzle on chocolate syrup.
steps.description: Try going up and down, then side to side. This provides a good amount of chocolate syrup without over-doing it.

steps.headline: Take one last whole Oreo and stick it, slightly tilted, into the centre of the pie.
steps.description: Position it so that it is between a 90º and 135º angle. It'll make the pie appear more decorative and yummy.

text: Set out your ingredients. Include any tools you think might help you. Cut five to ten Oreos into fourths. You can even cut them into different amounts so it looks a little more normal and un-processed. Make sure if you want to go crazy with the Oreos that you leave at least one left over and not cut! Mix the Oreo bits into the ice cream. Before you mix, you might want to set the ice cream out for fifteen minutes or so. Then, you won't break your wrist while mixing! Scoop out the mint chocolate chip ice cream and place it in the pie crust. Don't fill the crust to the top, but go near it. You may want to flatten and spread the ice cream as you set it in the crust to keep track of how much ice cream you'll need. Flatten the ice cream. You can use a sifting-type ting with a butter knife or flatten it down with a spatula or even a cleaver. The more even the pie, though, the prettier it will look. Drizzle on chocolate syrup. Try going up and down, then side to side. This provides a good amount of chocolate syrup without over-doing it. Take one last whole Oreo and stick it, slightly tilted, into the centre of the pie. Position it so that it is between a 90º and 135º angle. It'll make the pie appear more decorative and yummy.
